Title: Option of Advance Amendment as Document Type using CT Sales Template

Their concern is that, since they are using ClearTax, they should not have to rely on external templates. They specifically require the ability to ingest ‘Advance Amendment’ data at a document level using the ClearTax template. Additionally, the client handles a high volume of B2C transactions approximately 40,000 to 50,000 per month.

Title: Advance Adjustment Amendment option in the CT Sales Template
Description: The client has requested that the ClearTax Sales template support the ‘Advance Adjustment Amendment’ document type so they can ingest this data directly through the CT template. At present, the Sales template does not contain the required headers or configuration for this document type, which prevents the client from uploading these transactions within the ClearTax platform. We have suggested using the Government template for summary level ingestion, but the client is not aligned with this approach, as they expect all their data ingestion processes to be supported within ClearTax itself. This is especially important for them because they handle a very high volume of B2C transactions. Therefore, the client is requesting that the ClearTax portal provide full support for uploading Advance Adjustment Amendment data at a document level, and we need to evaluate enabling this capability in the CT Sales template.

Title: Inconsistent Document Number Matching Logic in G1 vs SR and 2B vs PR
Description: I have observed an inconsistency in how document numbers with a “/” (slash) are handled across different reconciliation modules. In Sales Reconciliation (G1 vs SR), an invoice with a slight difference in document number formatting (e.g., with or without “/”) is classified under Missing, even when all other fields match exactly in both G1 and the Sales Register. However, in 2B vs PR Reconciliation, the same type of difference in document number (presence or absence of “/”) is categorized under Suggested Match. Could you please clarify why the logic for document number matching is different across these two reconciliation workflows? Due to this behaviour, the client is being forced to delete data in the Sales Register/GSTR-1 if they want the invoices to be considered for G1 filing, which is causing operational challenges. Requesting your guidance on whether this difference in logic is intentional, and if not, whether it can be aligned for consistency across modules.

Title: GL Stream - Need further split in Sub-status column in Revenue GL
Description: Greaves cotton is a recently integrated client. They have branch transfer of goods within and outside the state. In case of inter-state branch transfer of goods, there is levy of GST which gets billed from supplier state to recipient state. In integration GST SR, this scenario coded properly. However, in ERP an entry is passed in a way that the revenue GL gets nullified. Since goods are moving from one state to another but within the same PAN, they first book revenue account and then reverse revenue account, both within the same entry instead of passing separate Sale and Purchase entry. Due to this, in Revenue GL recon, Taxable value GL column is always of value "0" while in Taxable value SR column, there'll be sale value. Bucketing of all such cases happens in "Mismatch" section. But in sub-status column, bucketing is classifed as "Others". Client's ask is that in such cases we should bucket them as "Inter-state transfers". Further logic, if Supplier and Recipient GSTIN is same, "Inter-state transfers" bucketing should apply.
